BiblioEntry.Title: A balanced scorecard-based model for evaluating e-learning and conventional pedagogical activities in nursing
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: A balanced scorecard-based model for evaluating e-learning and conventional pedagogical activities in nursing [Elektronski vir] / Tomaž Hovelja, Damjan Vavpotič and Boštjan Žvanut

BiblioSet.Title: Assessment & evaluation in higher education
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Assessment & evaluation in higher education

BiblioEntry.Abstract: The evaluation of e-learning and conventional pedagogical activities in nursing programmes has focused either on a single pedagogical activity or the entire curriculum, and only on students or teachers' perspective. The goal of this study was to design and test a novel approach for evaluation of e-learning and conventional pedagogical activities that considers students', teachers' and managers' perspectives. A case study of the proposed approach was performed at a publicly funded nursing faculty with Slovenian and Italian students from 2009 to 2012. The case study was combined with focus group discussions, interviews, direct observation and survey. The proposed approach allows management to compare the value of different pedagogical activities through the students', teachers' and managers' perspectives. The approach proved useful in the evaluation of pedagogical activities and provided valid arguments for long-term pedagogical process improvement
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: evaluation /curriculum /cost-effectivness /e-learning

BiblioEntry.Title: Ravnanje z informacijsko tehnologijo: ključni strateški razvojni problem podjetij v Sloveniji? = Managing information technology: the key strategic issue facing enterprises in Slovenia?
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Ravnanje z informacijsko tehnologijo: ključni strateški razvojni problem podjetij v Sloveniji? = Managing information technology: the key strategic issue facing enterprises in Slovenia? / Tomaž Hovelja

BiblioSet.Title: Naše gospodarstvo
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Naše gospodarstvo
BiblioSet.Subtitle: revija za aktualna gospodarska vprašanja
review of current problems in economics

BiblioEntry.Abstract: S prehodom razvitih družb v informacijsko dobo narašča pomen informacijske tehnologije (IT) v podjetjih pri njihovem strateškem razvoju. Zaradi tega se veča tudi potreba po ravnanju uprav z IT, ki bo sposobno uresničiti vse njene potenciale pri ustvarjanju dodane vrednosti. Raziskava na vzorcu 94-ih med 1000 največjimi nefinančnih podjetji v Sloveniji je žal pokazala, da pri nas uprave velikokrat ne sprejmejo določenih ključnih ukrepov za uresničenje večine potencialov IT. V prispevku predstavljamo trenutno manjkajoče ključne ukrepe, ki jih moramo sistematično vključiti v strategijo in proces ravnanja z IT v podjetjih, da bi odpravili trenutne probleme pri pridobivanju strateških koristi IT.

With the evolution of the information society, the strategic importance of information technology (IT) in enterprises is increasing day by day. Thus, it has become vital to manage IT in a way that enables enterprises to realize all the potential benefits IT can offer for the creation of added value. This research conducted on a sample drawn from the 1000 biggest non-financial enterprises in Slovenia unfortunately shows that this need remains mostly unfulfilled. In this paper we present key theoretical and empirical factors that need to be systematically incorporated in the strategy and process of managing IT before enterprises in Slovenia can successfully solve this strategic issue.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: informacijska tehnologija /uporaba /Slovenija /podjetje

BiblioEntry.Title: Organisational effects on information technology productivity in enterprises : the case of Slovenia
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Organisational effects on information technology productivity in enterprises : the case of Slovenia / Tomaž Hovelja
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: the case of Slovenia

BiblioSet.Title: Economic and business review
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Economic and business review

BiblioEntry.Abstract: The study presents the results of a survey among 94 of Slovenia's 1,000 biggest enterprises based on the added value they generate. The aim of the research is threefold: a) to find out if and how different organisational characteristics of Slovenian enterprises affect their information technology (IT) usage; b) to explore how the intensity of IT usage affects the productivity of Slovenian enterprises; and c) to analyse and compare the findings on key organisational characteristics and the intensity of IT usage in the developed OECD countries with the findings from this study. My study reveals a number of positive organisational affects on the intensity of IT use in Slovenian enterprises that were seen as key organisational characteristics in other studies conducted in the developed OECD countries. However, most of these positive organisational characteristics of Slovenian enterprises are limited to the cultural and structural dimensions of their organisation and do not extend much into the strategical and process dimensionas they did in the developed OECD countries. Such findings can be explained by the lack of available managerial knowledge on how to strategically use IT in Slovenia to increase the productivity of the enterprise. The deficit in managerial knowledge coupled with strong influencest he employees have on the behaviour of enterprises in Slovenia can thus be seen as the main reason for a lower intensity of IT usage in enterprises as compared to developed OECD and EU countries. Even more importantly, it can be seen as the reason why the benefits from intense use of IT in the enterprise generally do not transform in productivity gains for the enterprise but instead transform in diminished workloads for the employees. Managerial implication with respect to building organisational characteristics that would confront the lack of productivity gains from the intense use of IT are presented based on the findings of this study.

Članek predstavlja rezultate raziskave, v katero je bilo vključenih 94 izmed 1000 največjih podjetij v Sloveniji po ustvarjeni dodani vrednosti. Cilji raziskave so: a) ugotoviti ali in kako različne organizacijske lastnosti podjetij v Sloveniji vplivajo na njihovo uporabo informacijske tehnologije (IT), b) raziskati povezanost med intenzivnostjo uporabe IT in produktivnostjo v podjetjih v Sloveniji, c) primerjati ugotovitve o ključnih organizacijskih lastnostih podjetij za učinkovito uporabo IT in intenzivnosti uporabe IT v razvitih članicah OECD z ugotovitvami te raziskave. Moja raziskava odkriva pozitivne vplive številnih organizacijskih lastnosti na intenzivnost uporabe IT v podjetjih v Sloveniji, ki so se kot ključne lastnosti organizacije podjetja pokazale v že opravljanih raziskavah v razvitih članicah OECD. Vendar se velika večina organizacijskih lastnosti, ki pozitivno vplivajo na uporabo IT, nahaja le znotraj organizacijskih dimenzij kulture in struktur ter ne vključuje skoraj nobene lastnosti iz strateške in procesne dimenzije, kar je v precejšnjem nasprotju z že opravljenimi raziskavami v razvitih članicah OECD. Posledično ne presenešajo slabsi rezultati in nižja intenzivnost uporabe IT pri nas v primerjavi z razvitimi članicami OECD. Razloge za tako stanje je zelo verjetno potrebno iskati v pomanjkanju managerskih znanj za učinkovito ravnanje z IT v podjetjih v povezavi z nepričakovano močnimi vplivi zaposlenih na odločitve, zakaj in kako uporabljati IT v podjetjih. Zaposleni v podjetjih v Sloveniji namreč večino koristi od IT na delovnem mestu uspejo pridobiti zase in si tako zmanjšati delovne obremenitve, tako da v Sloveniji bolj intenzivna uporaba IT v podjetjih ne vodi v rast njihove produktivnosti, kot je to značilno za razvite države članice OECD. Organizacijske lastnosti in spremembe, ki bi jih bilo potrebno vpeljati v podjetja v Sloveniji za odpravo takega stanja, so prav tako predstavljene v članku z upanjem, da bodo managerjem v korist.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: Slovenija /podjetje /informacijska tehnologija /produktivnost
Slovenia /enterprises /information technology /productivity
